content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here's the function `clean_column` in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    # Lowercase the string
    col = lowercase(col)
    
    # Remove leading and trailing whitespaces
    col = strip(col)
    
    # Replace spaces, hyphens and other special characters with an underscore
    col = replace(col, r"[^-_a-z0-9]+" => r"_")
    
    return col
end
```

You can use this function to clean column names as follows:

```julia
julia> clean_column(" My Column_123 ")
"my_column_123"

julia> clean_column("Column with spaces and hyphens-and-numbers")
"column_with_spaces_and_hyphens_and_numbers"
```
